rComments: He's dope.

Took this course as a GE. Hands down one of the best professors I've ever had. Material isn't very easy, but he always uses examples and demonstrations to help you understand. Open Midterm and Final, but show up to class (iclicker quizzes regularaly).

Raja is a great professor. But I cannot support an instructor who puts a paywall on a passing grade in his class. Even if you already have a clicker, expect to pay $10 just to register it. You must buy a book new for $120, or buy a book code for $80 just to do the homework. You cannot pass the class otherwise. Opt for a class that doesnt farm you.

I LOVE THIS GUY. Took his class fall quarter, and it was great! Sometimes lectures can be bit dry and I took a nap during those but still scraped an A in the class. I recommend reading the chapters he assigns, though, and making sure you understand the concepts. My friends who didn't read regularly but studied right before tests managed a B+.

Raja is a great guy and he'll help you in office hours, but there's so much to cover in class that he literally can't cover it all, so he talks incredibly fast and without clarity. Tests are hard, but they're curved. Do the homework, go to class, and STUDY and make notecards even though the tests are open note!

I took ASTR1 and it was great. If you do the readings before class and pay attention to lecture it should be a breeze. Professor is super helpful and funny. You'll be lucky taking a course with him. He does do clicker quizzes which are pretty easy to get credit on. Tests are not bad at all, as long as you put a little time into studying.
I never went to the sections - they're optional. You need an iclicker and an access code for mastering astronomy, but I've never used the textbook.  Both midterms and the final are open note

The Best UCSC has to offer! This man is incredible! Interesting, engaging, and always available to help his students! I cannot believe I was lucky enough to receive him as a professor because it literally made my first quarter as a freshman a memorable one! If you get the opportunity, take his class! You wont regret it! Plus homework every 2 weeks!

Hands down he is the most awesome professor. He is funny, smart, and engages the students well with humor. Some of his midterms have some very odd questions that we might not really know or learnt, but overall if you know your material you will do well.

I LOVE RAJA. This is the best teacher/professor I've ever had (granted, I'm a first year). Because of this class I want to major in Astrophysics instead of psychology. I always was excited to go to this class. Raja knows everything about Astronomy and he's so friendly and likeable and approachable -- just great!! You won't regret taking this class!

Raj is the best! He is attractive and witty. His tests are open book and open note. Attendance is mandatory because there are iClicker quizzes every lecture. The content got a little difficult sometimes, but Raj is approachable and helpful whenever you don't understand something. He plays AWESOME music while he sets up at the beginning of class!

Amazing teacher. Great introductory course. Mandatory attendance kind of sucked, but I didn't mind going once I was there. Midterms/final open book open notes. Curves fairly generously, he won't fail you unless you just don't do the work.
The best tacher, he inspired me so much! I love love love him! One of the best teachers ever!

AWESOME professor. He's super knowledgeable and he makes his material clear. I took this my first quarter at UCSC for the GE and I admit, I was a little intimidated by the material (there's a lot and it can get confusing if you don't pay attention), however, he's approachable and the TA's are good. Tests are OPEN NOTES. Regardless, you'll love him!

Awesome instructor! On Halloween, he came to class dressed as a "black hole". He put on a black robe, an afro wig, and threw candy at us to demonstrate how jets from a black hole work. Super easy class and he makes it really interesting.

My quiz average A, 1st midterm B, 2nd midterm B, and got a C on the final exam...Came out with an A in the class. He curves big time. Classes are mandatory attendance. I didnt study much since the exams were openbook. BUT just because its easy doesnt mean you get to completely blow it off, my friends goofed off and ended up with B&Cs. Sad story.

One of my favorite professors by far! He clearly has a lot of knowledge/background on the subject and makes me want to learn. Never really use the book, go to class and you should be fine. All tests are open book and really not that hard; I took a pass/no pass option and wish I hadn't. Easy and fun - Highly recommend it!

hes a good teacher. But the use of the clicker is unacceptable because 1. it increases expense to the student 2. it is used as a computer emforcement of attendance and as a type of quiz. Because of the clicker my rating is absolute failure avoid

One of the best professors I've had. Really passionate about the subject and interested in making sure students understand the material. Tests were open book, yet still a bit challenging. Easy GE as long as you go to class.

Raja is awesome! His midterms and final are open note open book because he wants you to learn concepts and not memorize facts. He has a great accent, is very funny, and just such a wonderful teacher. I didnt need this class for a GE or anything but it turned out to be one of the best classes I've ever taken!
Great class.  Study a bit, take a few notes and you can't go wrong.  He's got a great science nerd sense of humor if you're into that.
Raja is very entertaining and very funny. He's a great lecturer and fun to listen to.

raja is the most bad ass teacher around. Not only does he put effort into helping us do well, but his humor is beyond compare. My friends and i still quote him. oh yea... we BS-d the finaal and got an A.... all you need to do is PRETEND to work..and you will get an A. SO EASY. and we LOVE raja!

A really nice guy, passionate about the material. Lectures were organized and entertaining, all done on Powerpoint, and he even puts the files online so you can print them out. He really wants you to learn and he does a good job of helping you do so. Tests followed lecture material closely.
Great sense of humor; very engaging teacher.  In class quizes space out class really well - I've got unmedicated ADD and I've yet to have any issues.  Definitely a class to look forward to.
The class isn't all that easy if you don't know your math and physics, but Raja can answer most questions you have about something, and he's very clear in lectures.

He's incredibly clear and will review anything you don't understand in class. I'm horrible at science and pulled off a B+...everything is based off the lectures, so just take notes. He's not terribly boring, either.
Awesome frickin' teacher! It was his teaching that helped me get an A!

Great teacher, explains things well, but not necessarily in an exciting manner.  He is what I call a by-the-book teacher, meaning you can skip all of his lectures and just read the textbook, and you'll still do well.

Raja is very knowledgeable but his lectures can be pretty dry. Take good notes and listen attentively to the best of your ability. The tests are entirely based on the lectures and (mostly) the math. Your TA will be your best friend if you can't do math.

I simply took Intro to the Cosmos for the GE, but this guy made the most engaging lectures I ever listened to.  The way he talks makes him just sound smart, which makes you WANT to listen to him.  His humor flows seamlessly into his talk and keeps you awake. Plus, this guy is very helpful one-on-one and I got an A+. One of the best professors ever

such a nice guy! you can tell he wants you to pass his class and he'll help you out to make that happen. large curve, easy homework. open note and book midterm and final. course material is interesting and somewhat easy to understand. TA was useless though. but he's great! take a class with him, i recommend it
pretty easy, really nice teacher. he has a sense of humor. definitely an easy GE, but you still learn a good amount. recommended

Raja is a great teacher. Class can be a little confusing because he knows his field so well, but approach him one on one and he will help you with anything. Attendance to lecture isn't mandatory, but he gives iclicker quizzes almost daily that are 15% of your grade. So go! I'd sit though his adorable and funny lectures any day :)
Very knowledgeable. Explained special relativity well. Raja's funny and very sarcastic. The class is easy, provided you actually attend class and take notes.

Raja's a really good professor. He's really funny, so the material actually sinks in, and he answers questions in helpful ways. He's really invested in helping people understand the material. The tests are also really fair and relevant. Take Raja's classes if you need a Q.

He's the best, definitely take this class, even if you aren't an astrophysics major.. it's very interesting. Raja explains things very well even if it's the most abstract concept, he'll make you understand for sure.

Raja is one of the best professors on this campus. There's a certain style to his lecturing that really just makes you understand the material. And if you don't understand it, ask a question. He believes every question is a good question and he has no problem explaining things over and over again. TAKE RAJA! You'll learn so much in his class!

Raja is amazing!!! i was entirely not interested in the subject, just took it for a Q, but it was my favorite class I've taken so far. He is very clear, knows a vast wealth  of information on the subject. Plus his accent is adorable, and he tells the funniest retarded jokes. Take this class.

Most fun I've had in a class - ever.  Give your clicker to a friend who goes to class and you'll never have to attend.  Online study guide makes tests a breeze.  Go on the field trip, kick back, enjoy Raja's nerdy humor.

Raja was a great professor that made my first college science class and quater fun. I just loved him, you didn't even feel like it was a class that fulfill the Q requirment when you were done. Take any class with him teaching.

The first thing anyone should know about raja is that he is definetly a rebel on a mission. His favorite quote was "F**k the Man!" even though I can't remember him ever saying that, its the general feeling I got. He owns a mo-ped. He does donuts on my provost's yard. He is very passionate, and has a furious temper, Mostly directed towards education

Raja was super patient and helpful, even when people asked the same dumb questions over and over. He's great at explaining everything. He's quirky and his lectures are entertaining.  Plus he's a total badass.  I would be an Astronomy major, if only Raja taught all of my classes.

Raja is a fantastic teacher. He cares about his students and wants to answer everyone's questions even in a 200 person class. He likes to make classes interesting by playing tricks on us and occasional music and candy (oh i wish i could make this up!)... overall, he's just an awesome guy.
very good instructor.  made sure everything was clear and no questions unanswered.
Raja is a funny guy and made a subject I'm not interested in interesting. If you want to take Overview of the Universe, take it with him.

Raja's lectures were always engaging as well as entertaining. The class moved at a perfect pace and was challenging enough without being too frustrating. The exams were a bit hard, but as long as you're good with math then you should be fine.

Raja was a really good teacher. He was funny and informative and he knows how to give a good lecture. The tests weren't too hard. You'll need to know basic algebra. But still, his class rocked and he rocked too.
Raja is awesome dudes.  He is hilarious and sexy without a doubt.  His class is so easy that my dog took the final and failed.  I still got an A in the class though.  We heart Raja with all our <3

I took overview of the Universe with Raja, and it was awesome.  I felt like I learned a ton in the class, and he always made the topics fun and interesting, and the tests were open book open note as well.  highly recommended.
